files.description: Centralized path-resolution utilities that define OUTPUT_DIR (defaulting to ./outputs/) and provide helpers to build output file paths consistently across the codebase.

files.description: Test that scans the repository to fail if any Python code references an absolute '/outputs' path instead of using the centralized OUTPUT_DIR resolver.

missionDescription: Create a single `src/utils/paths.py` (or similar) that resolves `OUTPUT_DIR` (default `./outputs/`), update all writers to use it, and add a test that fails if any code attempts absolute `/outputs`.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Standardizes output-path handling to repo-relative `./outputs/` (with optional env override), preventing permission/path bugs and enforcing the fixed artifact contract. Also creates a reusable code pa...
projectName: single `src/utils/paths.py` (or similar) that resolves `OUTPUT_DIR` (default `./outputs/`), update all writers to use it, and add a test that fails if any code attempts absolute `/outputs`.
